talk.author: did:plc:vnqqj4nfak4e6gmoggsjfe7z
talk.utter: I hate to disagree, but yes, they will vote R again and again. As education declines and propaganda increases, they will persist.

talk.author: did:plc:leovo3nhqpqewrs3udolcsxo
talk.utter: Well, no one votes Nazi anymore. At least, not in Germany after the fall. Same thing will happen after the collapse of the American project here. No one will vote Republican again.

talk.author: did:plc:vnqqj4nfak4e6gmoggsjfe7z
talk.utter: But people do vote nazi, even in Germany. The far right wing has surged there. Trust me, some people’s desire for a strongman does not go away. Immediately after WWII nazism was present in Germany. You think they learned? Nah.

talk.author: did:plc:vnqqj4nfak4e6gmoggsjfe7z
talk.utter: But people do vote nazi, even in Germany. The far right wing has surged there. Trust me, some people’s desire for a strongman does not go away. Immediately after WWII nazism was present in Germany. You think they learned? Nah.

talk.author: did:plc:leovo3nhqpqewrs3udolcsxo
talk.utter: My point was, if Republicans get there way, ultimately, they'll go the way of the Dodo. At least until the Know Nothing party rears its head under a different name again.

talk.author: did:plc:vnqqj4nfak4e6gmoggsjfe7z
talk.utter:
One more gloomy option is this is the end of democracy in the US, as Cheeto has promised.
That being the case, we are 20-50 years from the next election. By then everyone will have forgotten… so, after a brief pause we will rinse and repeat.
